answers.author: Robert Carty
answers.text:
Eons ago I worked for the City of San Diego, and we had such a plan. I recall a heavy focus on brand identity, style guides, and example formats. They also started a unified communications team to get all the various PIOs together on a regular basis. This was all a new venture for the city when I was there, and there was some grumbling. I'll look in my old files, and if I can find anything I'll attach.

author: Jill Silverboard
text:
For cities with centralized communications across various functions and services, do you have a comprehensive public communications protocol for using brand (logos, taglines) materials, providing standards for developing written materials and publications, managing use of social media and related communications external to the organization?
We have a social media policy, but not a comprehensive plan for our Communications Department to govern written and online communications on behalf of the manay departments and staff of the city.
title: Communication Protocols
